org.fluidity.composition.container.spi

Class EmptyComponentContainer<C extends DependencyGraph>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fluidity.composition.container.spi.EmptyComponentContainer<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - the type of dependency graph used internally by a particular subclass.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentContainer, ComponentRegistry, MutableContainer, ObservedContainer, OpenContainer

    public abstract class EmptyComponentContainer<C extends DependencyGraph>
extends Object
implements MutableContainer, ObservedContainer, ComponentRegistry
    Implements basic method relationships and functionality on behalf of actual container and registry implementations. The public facade of dependency injection container implementations must extend this base class and wrap a DependencyGraph implementation.

    Usage

    You don't interact with an internal interface.

    • Method Detail

      • observed

        public final ObservedContainer observed(ComponentContainer.Observer observer)
        Returns a new container that calls the given observer whenever a dependency is resolved while resolving a component interface via the returned container.
        Specified by:
        observed in interface ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer to call, may be null.
        Returns:
        a new container instance backed by this one and using the provided resolution observer.

      • getComponent

        public final <T> T getComponent(Class<T> api)
        Looks up by interface or (super)class and returns a component. This method is provided for boundary objects (objects created outside the container by third party tools) to acquire their dependencies. If there was no explicit binding to the provided class, no component is returned.

        Note: This method does not allow modification of the component context at the point of invocation so rather than reaching into the container with this method, a better way is to call ComponentContainer.instantiate(Class, ComponentContainer.Bindings...) to gain access to components in this container.

        Specified by:
        getComponent in interface OpenContainer
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type to return.
        Parameters:
        api - a class object that was used to bind a component to; never null.
        Returns:
        the component bound to the give class or null when none was found.

      • getComponentGroup

        public final <T> T[] getComponentGroup(Class<T> api)
        Looks up by interface or (super)class and returns the list of components implementing the given interface, provided that they each, or the given interface itself, has been marked with the @ComponentGroup annotation. This method is provided for boundary objects (objects created outside the container by third party tools) to acquire their dependencies. If there was no explicit binding to the provided class, no component is returned.

        Note: This method does not allow modification of the component context at the point of invocation so rather than reaching into the container with this method, a better way is to call ComponentContainer.instantiate(Class, ComponentContainer.Bindings...) to gain access to components in this container.

        Specified by:
        getComponentGroup in interface OpenContainer
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component group type to return.
        Parameters:
        api - the group interface class.
        Returns:
        an array of components that belong to the given group, or null when there is no such group.

      • resolveComponent

        public final void resolveComponent(Class<?> api)
        Resolves the component bound to the given interface and all dependent components without instantiating them. Dynamic dependencies, e.g., those resolved in component constructors will not be picked up by this method.
        Specified by:
        resolveComponent in interface ObservedContainer
        Parameters:
        api - the component interface.

      • resolveGroup

        public final void resolveGroup(Class<?> api)
        Resolves the component group bound to the given interface and all dependent components without instantiating them. Dynamic dependencies, e.g., those resolved in component constructors will not be picked up by this method.
        Specified by:
        resolveGroup in interface ObservedContainer
        Parameters:
        api - the group interface.

      • invoke

        public final Object invoke(Object component,
                           Method method,
                           Object... arguments)
                    throws ComponentContainer.ResolutionException,
                           InvocationTargetException
        Calls invoke(component, true, method, arguments).

        Invokes the given method of the given object after resolving and injecting its applicable parameters that the given argument list contains no (or null) value for.

        Specified by:
        invoke in interface ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        component - the method to invoke on the provided object.
        method - the method that needs its parameters injected.
        arguments - the method parameters matching the method's signature with null values where injection is needed.
        Returns:
        the result of the method invocation.
        Throws:
        ComponentContainer.ResolutionException - when dependency resolution fails.
        InvocationTargetException - when the supplied method throws an exception.

      • instantiate

        public final <T> T instantiate(Class<T> componentClass,
                               ComponentContainer.Bindings... bindings)
                        throws ComponentContainer.ResolutionException
        This method creates a child container, binds the given class and the given bindings, and then asks for an instance of the given class from the child container. No caching takes place with this last step, a new component instance is created at every invocation of this method.

        If the given class object represents a concrete class, this method instantiates that class as a component, injecting in the process its constructor and field dependencies from the given bindings and the receiving container.

        If the given class is an interface, this method binds, in addition to the given bindings, every component class whose scope is set to the given class including the implementation of the given interface itself, and then performs the foregoing.

        Specified by:
        instantiate in interface ComponentContainer
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the component to instantiate.
        Parameters:
        componentClass - the component class to instantiate.
        bindings - the local component bindings.
        Returns:
        the new component.
        Throws:
        ComponentContainer.ResolutionException - when dependency resolution fails.

      • complete

        @SafeVarargs
public final <T> T complete(T component,
                                         Class<? super T>... api)
                                  throws ComponentContainer.ResolutionException
        Wraps the given component in a proxy that injects all missing @Inject annotated parameters of any method of all, or the given, component interfaces of the supplied component.
        Specified by:
        complete in interface ComponentContainer
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the component to wrap.
        Parameters:
        component - a component that needs field injection of dependencies.
        api - optional list of component interfaces to expose by the returned object.
        Returns:
        a new component that implements all, or the given, component interfaces and injects missing method parameters from this container.
        Throws:
        ComponentContainer.ResolutionException - when dependency resolution fails.

      • intercepting

        public final ComponentContainer intercepting(ComponentInterceptor... interceptors)
        Returns a child container with this one as its parent and with the given component interceptors active, in addition to those found in the class loader ancestry of this container.
        Specified by:
        intercepting in interface ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        interceptors - the component interceptors to activate in the container.
        Returns:
        a new child container.
